metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8284 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.6.31 and earlier and 5.7.13 and earlier allows local users to affect availability via vectors related to Server: Replication.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
